conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds.
The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s).
The graph shows the velocity of the skydiver as a function of time.
We are interested in the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
The slope of the velocity-time graph gives the acceleration.
A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
In the 0 to 10 seconds interval, the graph is increasing.
This means the slope is positive.
Since the slope is positive, the acceleration is positive.
This indicates that the skydiver is experiencing an increase in velocity, which means the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity.
The velocity is positive throughout the graph.
The positive velocity indicates that the skydiver is moving downward (assuming the positive direction is downward).
Since the acceleration is positive and the velocity is also positive, the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
